1.text: A wise son listens to his father’s instruction, but a scoffer doesn’t listen to rebuke.

2.text: By the fruit of his lips, a man enjoys good things; but the unfaithful crave violence.

3.text: He who guards his mouth guards his soul. One who opens wide his lips comes to ruin.

4.text: The soul of the sluggard desires, and has nothing, but the desire of the diligent shall be fully satisfied.

5.text: A righteous man hates lies, but a wicked man brings shame and disgrace.

6.text: Righteousness guards the way of integrity, but wickedness overthrows the sinner.

7.text: There are some who pretend to be rich, yet have nothing. There are some who pretend to be poor, yet have great wealth.

8.text: The ransom of a man’s life is his riches, but the poor hear no threats.

9.text: The light of the righteous shines brightly, but the lamp of the wicked is snuffed out.

10.text: Pride only breeds quarrels, but with ones who take advice is wisdom.

11.text: Wealth gained dishonestly dwindles away, but he who gathers by hand makes it grow.

12.text: Hope deferred makes the heart sick, but when longing is fulfilled, it is a tree of life.

13.text: Whoever despises instruction will pay for it, but he who respects a command will be rewarded.

14.text: The teaching of the wise is a spring of life, to turn from the snares of death.

15.text: Good understanding wins favor; but the way of the unfaithful is hard.

16.text: Every prudent man acts from knowledge, but a fool exposes folly.

17.text: A wicked messenger falls into trouble, but a trustworthy envoy gains healing.

18.text: Poverty and shame come to him who refuses discipline, but he who heeds correction shall be honored.

19.text: Longing fulfilled is sweet to the soul, but fools detest turning from evil.

20.text: One who walks with wise men grows wise, but a companion of fools suffers harm.

21.text: Misfortune pursues sinners, but prosperity rewards the righteous.

22.text: A good man leaves an inheritance to his children’s children, but the wealth of the sinner is stored for the righteous.

23.text: An abundance of food is in poor people’s fields, but injustice sweeps it away.

24.text: One who spares the rod hates his son, but one who loves him is careful to discipline him.

25.text: The righteous one eats to the satisfying of his soul, but the belly of the wicked goes hungry.
